--- layout: default title: OHBM 2013 ---
This collection organizes a number of different posters and talks from NISOx and NISOx collaborators at the 2013 Organization for Human Brain Mapping (OHBM) in Seattle, 16-20 June.

Talks

This section lists all available OHBM 2013 standalone talks by NISOx and NISOx collaborators.
  • Voxel-wise and Cluster-based Heritability Inference for fMRI Data
    Authors: Xu Chen, Gabriella Blokland, Lachlan Strike, Thomas Nichols. Selected for oral presentation and first author was travel award winner. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5484373.v1
  • Analysis of Multiple Sclerosis Lesions via Spatially Varying Coefficients
    Authors: Tian Ge, Nicole Muller-Lenke, Kerstin Bendfeldt, Thomas Nichols, Timothy D. Johnson. Selected for oral presentation and first author was travel award winner. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5484379.v1
  • Overview of Meta-Analysis Approaches
    Author: Thomas Nichols. Neuroimaging Meta-Analysis. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5484382.v1

Posters

This section lists all available posters submitted to OHBM 2013 by NISOx and NISOx collaborators.
  • Voxel-wise and Cluster-based Heritability Inferences of fMRI Data
    Authors: Xu Chen, et al.
  • Alternative thresholding procedure with application to pre-surgical fMRI
    Authors: Joke Durnez, et al.
  • Post-hoc power estimation for topological inference in fMRI
    Authors: Joke Durnez, et al.
  • Analysis of Multiple Sclerosis Lesions via Spatially Varying Coefficients
    Authors: Tian Ge, et al.
  • Fast and accurate modelling of longitudinal neuroimaging data: an application to ADNI data
    Authors: Bryan Guillaume, et al.
  • Understanding the Mesoscale Structure of the C. elegans Brain Network
    Authors: Dragana M. Pavlovic, et al.
  • Non-Parametric Combination for Analyses of Multi-Modal Imaging
    Authors: Anderson M. Winkler, et al.

Courses

This section lists all available OHBM 2013 courses created by or contributed towards by NISOx and NISOx collaborators.
  • How Not to Analyze Your Data - A Skeptical Introduction to Modeling Methods
  • Introduction to Imaging Genetics
